alternatives.transcript: thank you mr. chair

I in 1957 was president of the American Psychological Association and I am currently past president of the American Psychological Foundation I'm a member of the evaluation research Society will take more time thank you

for several years I've been involved in an evaluation of research on the can the current state of knowledge about psychological aspects of smoking I recently wrote the section entitled smoking behavior that will be published this year in the Wily Encyclopedia of psychology I've reviewed House Bill 1824 and field that subsection 7 of the findings and purpose section misrepresents current

current scientific understanding of smoking Behavior as a consequence it is my belief that the provision of the proposed bill that mandates a warning on cigarette packages stating that cigarette smoking is addictive is clearly unwarranted I must note at this juncture that I reviewed the recent pamphlet why people smoke cigarettes which was developed by the Department of Health and Human Services frankly I'm disappointed

why didn't this lack of scientific objectivity last year at a similar hearing I pointed out that asking the people who are doing the research in this matter whether smoking is addictive is akin to asking the goat to guard the lettuce patch these people have come to a emotional conclusion that smoking is addictive and seek to underscore approve it by emphasizing only those research findings

that are consistent with that view I need only to point out that the vast majority of the supporting references in the new pamphlets are published Publications that are developed and released by government Health Department's these Publications have carefully examined includes strong disclaimers and questions about the so-called facts cited in the pamphlet yet these disclaimers by our most eminent smoking
just are not mentioned in the pamphlet

in my view dr. Paul's testimony provides a good example of the pervasive definitional Hopscotch characteristic of discussions in this area according to my training my experience in my practice the word Addiction is a medical term referring specifically to the use of psychoactive drugs and gangs increasingly escalating doses

due to a tolerance to their effects and motivated strongly by the avoidance of Fairly consistent medically consequential withdrawal symptoms following abstinence it is further characterized by an increase tendency to irresponsible or antisocial Behavior yet although dr. pollen initially describes his testimony as having to do with the addictive properties of tobacco smoking he goes on to describe

few specific areas in fact no areas that I know of of Applied psychological research have received greater attention than the cigarette smoking be habit and in spite of this intense scientific focus on the behavioral as well as the physiological aspects of cigarette smoking no General agreement among scientists in the careful definitive summary articles that appear regularly in all scientific area exist as to the
